chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Richard Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Attempt Disarming a Peace Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.21.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge= $518.00- payment to be worked out with agent.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No alcohol at residence. No entrance into any bars, taverns or liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. May dine at an establishment that serves alcohol, but may not sit at the bar and anyone sitting at the table may not have alcohol. Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with advanced agent approval. Must take all prescribed medication and only as prescribed. Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse. No entrance into Lolli's Bar. May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.

AODA and follow through. Mental health evaluation and follow through. Payment of restitution-amount to be agreed upon by the parties or a restitution hearing will be scheduled. Completion or all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. If probation is successfully completed, and deft stays free of any further crimes, court may grant expungement of this case. DNA sample due: 4-13-2022.

records.addlTxt:
11:28 AM Defendant Daniel Richard Anderson in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Daniel Richard Anderson in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case.
Copy of PSI.
Atty Hansen heard on corrections to PSI.
ADA heard - no corrections to PSI.
ADA heard on recommendation and sentencing.
Atty heard on restitution issues.
Court will reserve the order for payment of restitution until an agreement is made between the parties, or the matter will be heard at a restitution hearing to be scheduled for a later date.
ADA continues sentencing recommendations.
Court reviews support letters received.
Atty Hansen heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 2:
102 days jail.
Credit for 102 days time served.
Payment of $500 fine + costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $1083.00 due at $50 per month beginning 06-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 3:
18 months initial confinement, 18 months extended supervision, and places deft on probation for 3 years.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Conditions of probation:
Payment of costs + fees + DNA surcharge = $518.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
Payment of restitution - amount to be agreed upon by the parties or a restitution hearing will be scheduled.
Absolute sobriety.
No alcohol at residence.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Any medications, including those prescribed, may only be taken with advanced approval of agent.
Must take all prescribed medication and only as prescribed.
Must take any medications prescribed for mental health or substance abuse.
No entrance into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
May dine at an establisment that serves alcohol, but may not sit at the bar and anyone sitting at the table may not have alcohol.
No entrance into Lolli's Bar.
AODA and follow through.
Mental health evaluation and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling, and follow through as recommended by agent.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
DNA sample due 04-13-2022.
Appeal rights.
Parties to sort out the restitution issue within the next 30 days and contact the JA to schedule a hearing.
If probation is successfully completed, and deft stays free of any further crimes, court may grant expungement of this case.

Court calls case.
Atty Spansail appears for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Spansail heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $5000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, no alcohol, no contact with Lt. Cate or Officer Fischer except in their official capacities, No entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today.
